results.title: Product Manager
results.description:
ABOUT THE COMPANY
Bonfire is transforming the way people buy and sell high-quality custom apparel. We are a free online platform where anyone can design, sell, and buy custom products. We’ve helped thousands of individuals, groups, and nonprofits raise money for the causes they care about, and also serve the world’s top creators as their premiere custom merch platform. We’re a passionate, creative, and data-driven team constantly pursuing our vision: to strengthen communities that inspire a kinder world. We bring this vision to life by hiring passionate, smart people who celebrate and respect others, are committed to a life of curiosity, are never satisfied with ‘good enough’, are eager to co-create the future, and who thrive through teamwork. Have we been looking for you?

ABOUT THE JOB

Our Product team is searching for their future Product Manager. The ideal candidate will value critical thinking and intellectual honesty, and have an insatiable need to continuously improve oneself to learn and navigate new and changing technologies and market opportunities. 

Our Product Managers at Bonfire are “full stack” PMs. You will work closely with our engineering team, designers, and senior management to design solutions, in addition to participating in customer interactions to define needs, test out options, and get feedback for the features you release. You will ensure alignment with our Growth team: Customer Support, Marketing, and Sales.

In this role you will make decisions by being data-informed at all times and data-driven where appropriate. While using design thinking to bring our customers the best experience, it is also essential to communicate and collaborate with the Engineering team to create solutions to problems we want to solve, all while delivering high quality service to our customers and their markets. 

This role lies within our Product department and reports to the Director of Product. 

____________________

Bonfire employees are expected to embrace the Mission and Values, we live together and apart:  Humble Ingenuity, Trusting Partnerships, Inclusive Cooperation, Moral Courage, Healthy Dissatisfaction

Bonfire is currently supporting a virtual work environment; however, we are looking to only hire candidates who reside in the following locations: ​​North Carolina, Virginia, Washington DC, Maryland, and Pennsylvania.

____________________

ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES 

include but are not limited to:

  1. Interview customers to understand needs. Deeply understand our customers’ workflows and jobs-to-be-done.
  2. Define product requirements, communicate the “why” to engineers and executives alike.
  3. Meet and collaborate with stakeholders to source/validate/evolve features and the roadmap.
  4. Own and manage the backlog and roadmap for your area of responsibility. Prioritize between new features, architectural improvements, and operational excellence.
  5. Interact daily with the engineering and design teams in both the design and development phases by running the agile meetings.
  6. Create initial low-fi wireframes and coordinate hi-fi mockups with the product design team.
  7. Manage stakeholder expectations and communication for upcoming/planned releases.
  8. Contribute to the educational content of improvements and features to ensure smooth adjustment to stakeholder processes.
  9. Analyze and/or work with the Business Intelligence/Marketing teams to analyze the impact of platform changes & trends to inform future iterations.
 
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
  • Have 2+ years experience in product management.
  • Have 2+ years working within an agile software development framework.
  • Have 2+ years experience in ecommerce, saas, or a related industry.
  • Have experience working with datasets to analyze/answer business questions and/or build business cases.
  • Proficient in SQL and able to write basic to moderate queries.
  • Experience using analytics tools to explore trends in product feature usage & measure impact.
  • Experience using wireframing tools to create wireframes/prototypes/mockups for digital products.
 
ADDITIONAL DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS
  • Knowledge of and ideally experience managing roadmaps for web apps built using javascript frameworks such as Angular, React, Vue, etc.
  • Some actual coding experience is a plus, but not required.

 

WHY WORK AT BONFIRE? 

When team members all around the world were asked to find three words they’d use to describe Bonfire, the most commonly shared values were: kind, inclusive, charitable, supportive, collaborative, and passionate. Work here and help us guide people toward their full potential and possibility in support of a company that’s trying to infuse the world with more of those values. 

In addition to leading purposeful work, you will also benefit from our full-time employee offerings:  

  • Competitive compensation with great insurance and savings benefits
  • Remote work environment (We are a fully distributed team!)
  • Tech setup right-fit for your remote work environment 
  • Year-round swag giveaways
  • Unlimited PTO that we encourage everyone to take advantage of
  • A positive culture and dynamic team environment
  • The ability to help create a kinder planet
  • An environment to grow your skills, learn new technologies, and to challenge yourself 

Does this sound like you? If so, we’d love to hear from you!

results.title: Senior Product Manager
results.description:
Who are Tyk, and what do we do?

The Tyk API Management platform is helping to drive the connected world and power new products and services. We’re changing the way that organisations connect any number of their systems and services. Whether internal, external, public or highly encrypted systems, Tyk helps businesses drive value across the retail, finance, telecoms, healthcare, or media industries (to name just a few!)

If you’ve banked online, used an app to check the news, or perhaps even driven a connected car, API’s, and by extension, Tyk, make that possible. Founded in 2015 with offices in London - UK, London - Ontario, Atlanta and Singapore, we have many thousands of users of our B2B platform across the globe. Brands using Tyk range from Lotte, Bell, Dominos, Starbucks, to RBS and Societe Generale. We have a varied user base hailing from every continent – even Antarctica.

Our Mission

Tyk is on a mission to connect every system in the world. We’ve started by building an API Management platform.

Total flexibility, default remote, radical responsibility

We offer unlimited paid holidays and remote working from anywhere in the world, for everyone, Why? Tyk was founded on the principle of offering flexibility and autonomy to our employees, we believe this allows our employees to achieve their best results. It also means we can build the best possible team, location and working hours are no barrier.

If this sounds like an environment that you believe could work for you then read on to find out more.

Requirements

The role:

Tyk is one of the leading API management platforms competing on the market with AWS and Google. We are seen as ‘visionaries’ by Gartner and are looking for a snr. product manager to come help shape and bring that vision to life.

Product areas at Tyk are linked to the customer journeys involved in the API management lifecycle, so you’ll need to have a passion for understanding how technical teams work, and care about all interaction points in your product area, such as APIs, CLIs, documentation, GUIs and more.

Our Senior Product Managers at Tyk own their portfolio end to end and have a great level of autonomy in the decisions they take from vision and strategy to the releases and how we should market them.

Senior Product Managers at Tyk will own the direction, strategy and vision of a single product area, from concept through to release. In this outward facing role, you’ll be collaborating with every part of the business, as well as our customers and users, to define and validate your product direction.

Here’s what you’ll be getting up to:

  • Defining and maintaining the strategic roadmap for your product area in line with the wider company, product strategy and market needs
  • Be constantly looking for ways to improve your product area to better suit the needs of our customers and wider market
  • Prioritising themes of work and identifying how we can release value in small increments
  • Provide ongoing communications about your product area to the rest of the organisation and to our customers to build momentum and excitement
  • Communicating the customer and user needs of your product area for your delivery teams as well as the wider organisation
  • Ongoing measuring and reporting of how your product area is performing by means of commercial, marketing and product usage data
  • Empower the delivery teams in your product area to effectively translate your vision into a prioritised release plan - you should not be a bottleneck
  • Develop a deep understanding of your entire product area and become the internal knowledge hub for your product area to make effective decisions and set expectations this should all be clearly documented and available for all to see
  • Helping the commercial team to build effective pricing strategies for your product area

Here’s what we’re looking for:

  • Experience owning the end to end product lifecycle of technical products
  • Effective stakeholder management, negotiation and collaboration skills (both internal and external) - there will be competing priorities that you’ll need to manage
  • Customer centric mindset and data driven approach to product strategy
  • Great communication skills - you will be responsible for pulling together multiple stakeholders with varying needs and expectations, you need to align everyone
  • Clear understanding of how APIs work and the main challenges with managing APIs
  • Product & Systems thinking - Tyk is a complex technical product and you’ll be required to understand the ins and outs of the full user and system lifecycle

Benefits

Here’s why you should join us:

  • Everyone has unlimited paid holidays.
  • We have total flexibility in hours, as we believe creativity flows better when our people are given freedom to decide when they are most productive. Everyone is unique after all.
  • Employee share scheme
  • Generous maternity and paternity leave
  • Company retreats

We all share the same vision - we value authenticity, respect, responsibility, independence, honesty, diversity and inclusion and most importantly treating others how you wish to be treated. We look for like-minded people who bring their personalities to work everyday, strive to achieve their personal goals and who are willing to challenge the way we do things, why? - to make what we do even better!

Our values tell the story of Tyk - here’s how:

  • It’s ok to screw up!

We’ve found that it’s often the ‘stupid’ or unexpected ideas that turn out to be the successful ones - so try it, at least we can say we have!

  • The only stupid idea, is the untested one!

It’s in our DNA - starting a business with founders 12 hours apart, giving our gateway away for free - sure, we did that, and we’d do it again!

  • Trust starts with you - make it count!

Trust is a two-way street - instil it from day one!

  • Assume best intent!

We have each other’s back - we’re all on the same team. Think before you speak or act.

  • Make things better!

Always try to leave things better than when you found them - change is constant, inevitable and embraced! Be that change we want to see.

What’s it like to work here?! check it out: https://tyk.io/worklife/

Tyk is an equal opportunities employer and we are determined to ensure that no applicant or employee receives less favourable treatment on the grounds of gender, age, disability, religion, belief, sexual orientation, marital status, or race, or is disadvantaged by conditions or requirements which cannot be shown to be justifiable.

You can see more about us here https://tyk.io

results.title: Head of Product
results.description:
Do you believe that every company is now a tech company, and that cybersecurity matters to everyone? Do you believe cybersecurity should be effortless and affordable for every organization? Do you want to change an industry working with a team that’s already making a dent? If so, Fletch is the company for you.

Fletch’s Head of Product role is perfect for a creative, energetic, and disciplined product leader who has done startups before. This person has a track record of getting their hands dirty, developing thoughtful products that delight customers, and identifies the right talent to build an exceptional team. They must inspire, stand-out in their ability to simplify the complex, and maintain a relentless focus on the company’s north star.

Requirements

What you’ll do at Fletch

  • Partner with the rest of the leadership team to define the product vision, strategy, and roadmap for Fletch
  • Collaborate extensively with the Founder CEO and Head of design on building an elegant and simple product
  • Engage extensively with users, internal teams, and external partners in order to gain firsthand insight into the business needs & opportunities to deliver innovative, industry-transforming products
  • Facilitate and drive a product-led motion that drives unity throughout the organization
  • Collaborate with engineering leadership on project planning, spec creation, and meeting deadlines
  • Partner on growth metrics with other leaders (activation, retention, revenue, and referral)
  • Positioning, pricing and packaging in collaboration with Head of Sales
  • User research and experience in collaboration with the Head of Design
  • Product marketing in conjunction with the Marketing team
  • Being a doer while building a world class product organization as the company grows
  • Define and track metrics for success and set clear objectives within the product organization, while ensuring the team is properly set up to deliver on goals.


Required skills

  • At least eight years of product experience and three years of management experience
  • Proven track record of building exceptional products supported by specific case studies
  • Inspirational, empathetic, and practical leadership. You must be all three.
  • Practitioner of continuous product discovery
  • Driver of rapid experimentation and always curious
  • Deadline focused and strong at motivating others to push themselves
  • Detail-oriented and skilled at setting measurable goals and outcomes
  • Well trained in writing functional specs and working in cross-functional teams
  • Manager who has built or been part of building a product management teams
  • Fantastic communicator - great at partnering with engineering and design counterparts
  • Strong understanding and appreciation for user experience and product design
  • Great at partnering with other department heads to break down silos
  • Outstanding program/project management skills to manage the delivery of features, deadlines, and help unblock others (especially when collaborating with engineering)
  • Well organized, great at documentation, and competent Jira user
  • Love customer interactions and skilled at conducting research
  • Experienced with managing remote teams and leading in a remote environment\
Additional skills
  • Comes from a technical background
  • Experience building PLG and self-serve products
  • Recent startup experience in a similar role with some larger company exposure
  • Consumer and enterprise experience
  • Cybersecurity and analytics experience
  • Product marketing and copywriting experience


Benefits

Flexible leave policy
Health care insurance
Dental & vision insurance
Life insurance
Short-term & long-term disability insurance
Health care FSA
Flexible work hours
Holiday time off
401K

results.title: Product Owner
results.description:
A fully remote location in the UK, EU or US (east-coast only)

Role Overview 🚀

At Uncapped, we help ambitious founders to realise their dreams. We are growing rapidly and scaling our product team.

We are looking for Product Owners to lead product teams at Uncapped. The Product Owner role at Uncapped is similar to acting CEO of a start-up for their respective products. Our product is split into smaller products (startups) each having a fully cross-functional team of which you would be the leader.

As part of the Uncapped Product team, you will be involved in building the next generation of products suited specifically for the needs of fast-paced digital entrepreneurs. Our product mission is to reinvent funding, so every digital entrepreneur can access the capital and tools they need to grow big. Our goal is to have a team that can turn around customer and market insights and keep our product ahead of the competition. As a Product Owner, you work directly with one of the highest performing full-stack engineering and designer team.

About Uncapped 👫

Founded in 2019, Uncapped is the fastest, most affordable way for growing online businesses to fund marketing and inventory. The company was born out of frustration with the limited financing options available for the UK and European entrepreneurs to finance growth.

Uncapped provides business advances of between £10K and £10M without credit checks, personal guarantees, warrants, equity, or compounding interest -- and makes money by charging a low flat fee that is paid back from future sales revenue.

Uncapped has raised $120 million from investors including Lakestar, Mouro Capital, Global Founders Capital, White Star Capital, Seedcamp, and All Iron Ventures.

What you will do ✍️

You will:

  • Own one of our products end-to-end (P&L and OKR owner)
  • Truly understand customer needs and gather product requirements
  • Identify market opportunities and define product vision and strategy
  • Be responsible for a team of talented engineers, designers, operation managers
  • Act as a direct line manager of your team investing in people's growth
  • Work closely with designers to create amazing user experiences
  • Take full responsibility for delivering a product that real entrepreneurs love using in an agile fast paced process that you constantly perfect
  • You will be hiring other skills to make your startup successful

You will work with these tools:

  • Figma with a design system to deliver the best User Experience
  • Jira and related task management tools enable us to work lean
  • 15Five and other people management tools
  • Notion for documenting your insights and knowledge
  • Data analytics tools, which sometimes require proficiency in SQL
  • And, anything else you need

Requirements

Who you are 👀

  • You have demonstrated you can build and launch successful products that people love
  • Very strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Experience in fintech lending
  • Identify market opportunities quickly and can validate hypothesis hyper-methodological
  • Experience in scoping, prioritising, designing, and building customer-facing products
  • Strong in building intuitive design, navigation and UX
  • You are customer-focused and thrive on solving real-world pains
  • Experience in leading or working with highly technical people
  • Take initiative and is adaptive and flexible

Some rock stars also have (optional) 🎸

  • FinTech experience & understanding of the market
  • Experienced hyper-growth
  • B2B experience
  • Founded a company
  • Worked closely with e-commerce entrepreneurs

Benefits

 

What we offer 🎁

At Uncapped, our people make us successful. We are a startup with big goals and we work hard, so we want to give everyone the benefits they really want. We’re continually adding to this list as new people join -- here are some of the things you can expect:

  • A competitive compensation plan
  • Flexible working: Remote-first processes for ultimate flexibility
  • Unlimited paid time off to relax and see the world
  • Apple MacBook machine
  • A personal growth fund that helps you to become your best
  • Weekly recognition and awards that celebrate all the wins, both big and small
  • Annual retreat abroad to hang out with your team on a paid staff trip
  • A workspace just for you, with £350 or equivalent in €/$ to optimise your home office

We can only consider applications from those who are eligible to work, without sponsorship, in the location to which they have applied.

results.title: Group Product Manager - Core Experience
results.description:
We Are Redefining How People Approach Their Health
 
ZOE is combining scientific research at a scale never before imagined and cutting-edge AI to improve the health of millions. 
 
Created by the world’s top scientists, our personalised nutrition program is radically reimagining a fundamental human need – eating well for your own body. Currently available in the US, and with a waitlist of more than 250,000 in the UK, ZOE is already helping tens of thousands of ZOE members adopt healthier habits and achieve their goals.
 
We are also the team behind the popular COVID Symptom Study, which played a critical role in the fight against COVID in the UK and has now expanded to become the ZOE Health Study (ZHS). ZHS uses the power of community science to conduct large-scale research from the comfort of contributors’ homes to understand health and prevent disease. Our collective work and expertise in biology, engineering, data science, and nutrition science has led to multiple breakthrough papers in leading scientific journals such as Nature Medicine, Science, The Lancet, and more.
 
A remote-first, well-funded startup, we are backed by founders, investors, and entrepreneurs who have built multi-billion dollar technology companies. We are always looking for innovative thinkers and doers to join our team on a thrilling mission to tackle epic health problems that span the globe. Together, we can improve human health and touch millions of lives.
 
We value inclusivity, transparency, ownership, open-mindedness and diversity. We are passionate about delivering great results and learning in the open. We want our teams to have the freedom to make long-term, high-impact decisions, and the well-being of our teammates and the people around us is a top priority.
 
About the team
 
The Core Experience group owns the member experience from the moment someone hears about ZOE, all the way to their daily interactions with the ZOE app. This translates to a wide remit of responsibility across the funnel; from acquisition and retention all the way to referral. The goal is to help prospects adopt ZOE and make it a core part of their daily lives.
 
The core experience covers everything from the core nutrition programme, the tools we offer our clients to include the ZOE advice in their daily life, personalised recommendations, and integrations (e.g. wearables). The group defines the experience end to end and also works closely with other groups including science & recommendations to provide the most cutting-edge scientific insights and distill the complex calculations we use to produce simple, personalised recommendations which delight our members. 
 
About the role
 
We’re looking for a Group Product Manager to lead the group to help more members achieve their goals by making the ZOE experience the most delightful, easy, and, personalised health experience. You’ll work closely with the VP of Product, Design, and Engineering leads to shape the roadmap across squads, enable fast-paced execution, and drive impact and efficiency as we scale.



You will...
  • Driving world-class execution within your area. Setting the right cadence of delivering value to members, continuously improving the quality of the product, and diminishing risks to ensure high quality. 
  • Going above and beyond to deliver impact for our members. Working within the group, you will be focused on the essence of the problem and doing everything needed to ensure your teams make considerable progress in solving our members’ problems and have a sizeable impact on the organisation. 
  • Setting the success criteria for your Product Group. Ensuring your teams set the right success criteria across the lifecycle of the product is key to moving fast, delivering real value to our members, and setting the right level of ambition. 
  • Identifying, sizing, and prioritising opportunities for the group. You will be diving deep to understand customer problems and provide a robust, data-driven framework for prioritisation to ensure maximum value for our customers. You will also be responsible for pulling the break to “sound-good” ideas and articulating how simple changes lead to a long-term competitive edge. 
  • Inspiring the organisation to think big and grow. You will champion bold ideas and push your team work think big beyond their level of comfort. 
  • Leading to build the organisation and raising the bar: You will be mentoring both your team and the rest of the organization to be customer-centric and thinking big. By connecting the dots you are able to paint a vision of what great looks like and define what the next frontier for the product is.



We think this role would be a great fit if you...
  • Have extensive experience in effectively hiring, managing, and coaching world-class Product teams (preferably in a high-growth environment). 
  • Have been part of a (consumer) business that experienced rapid growth from pre-product-market-fit to Scaling is a strong plus.
  • Are experienced in leading product teams working cross-functionally to deliver end-to-end value in high-risk,  pioneering products.
  • Have a proven track record of being pivotal as an individual contributor in the success of one or more products and businesses. 
  • Have a deep understanding of the interplay between behavioural & cognitive psychology and their role in building habit-forming products. 
  • Have a strong aptitude in quantitative modeling of member behaviour (e.g. viral coefficients, predictive analytics) and championing effectively a culture of data-driven business cases for product teams.
  • Have good expertise in user-centric, rapid product development research methods such as mixed methods user research, product validation, RITE, and other relevant methodologies for sizing and prioritising customer problems. 
  • Have a STEM background and academic and/or professional experience in using big data, machine learning, and AI to deliver customer-facing products and solutions is considered a plus.
  • Are as comfortable getting hands-on as taking a step back and thinking strategically, proactively identifying issues and opportunities, and tackling them without being told to do so. 
  • Have intellectual curiosity & rigour.
Listed above is a snapshot of the experience, skills and attributes we think would come handy for the success in this role. Are you passionate about ZOE and this role but don't tick 100% of the boxes above? Please consider applying anyway. We are happy to up-skill where possible.
 
What you can expect from us
 
Aside from ensuring the industry-benchmark compensation package and providing you with all the hardware and software you need, we have worked hard for our list of benefits to be focused on things that matter to our team members most. 
 
Remote-first - work from home, pop into our London/Boston offices, or work within the EU; you have flexibility to choose your own place of work and work flexibly
Stock options -  we want everyone to be rewarded for contribution to our growth 
Paid time-off - on top of any national / bank holidays, you get 28 days off (25 plus 1 life-event and 2 company-wide reset days) 
Enhanced parental leave - adding on to the statutory offering, we know how important it is to be supportive at times that matter
Private healthcare and life assurance - flexible options to choose what fits 
Health and wellbeing - Employee Assistance Program, Cycle to Work and more 
Pension - paying monthly and offering flexibility to top your pension up 
Allocated social, WFH and Growth (L&D) budgets 
Plenty of learning and social opportunities 
 
We continue to build a benefits package that invests in our team members’ long-term personal and professional growth and wellbeing, adding to this list as it evolves.
 
Equal opportunities
 
We believe that having a truly diverse team where everyone can be their authentic self is the key to our success and we are committed to improving the tech industry for the better. We are passionate about equal opportunities and encourage candidates from any underrepresented backgrounds to apply. We don't discriminate based on race, colour, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, marital status, disability or age. When applying, please let us know of any accessibility requirements you may have for your interviews and we will do our best to accommodate.
 
While this position is advertised as full-time, we can be flexible on the specific arrangements and would be happy to discuss part-time, job-share or other flexible arrangements, if required.

results.title: Senior Product Manager
results.description:
The Charts team at BMAT is responsible for the compilation of the official music charts for the recording industry associations in more than 30 countries. We generate these charts from the extensive reports we receive from the most popular online music services in each of the countries in which we operate.

Our mission is to build the most complete and reliable music consumption database for our clients—from record labels to music publishers and music industry associations.

Our focus for the last few years has been on growth with a lean approach, and we’ve successfully built a solid base of customers. As we grow, we continue to build out and formalise our agile product development process, so that we can keep improving our service and scaling our business.

As a Product Manager, you will be responsible for turning our mission into a reality. You will work closely with our clients to understand their needs and transform them into an agile development roadmap and oversee the engineering team in charge of implementing it.

We're looking for someone with a proven track record of owning data-intensive products in agile B2B environments. Previous experience in the music business is a plus. A strong belief that music can save the world is a must.

Key Responsibilities

  • Define the product strategy and roadmap
  • Collect, manage and maintain traceability of requirements from all stakeholders across product releases
  • Set and iterate the team’s internal processes for fulfilling the product roadmap
  • Be the recognized expert in the business on the product, the market, relevant technology and the competition
  • Develop core positioning and messaging for the product

Requirements

  • Minimum of 4 years experience as a Product Manager working on software products in agile environments
  • Demonstrated success defining and launching excellent products
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Excellent decision-making, critical thinking and problem solving
  • Technical background, with experience in web-apps
  • Excellent teamwork skills
  • Proven ability to influence cross-functional teams without formal authority
  • Willing to overlap 5h with Barcelona 9-5.
  • Experience in the music industry is a plus

Interview Process

We will start contacting candidates in January.

  • Screening call with HR (30min)
  • Interview with team manager to discuss the project (45min)
  • Take home assignment
  • Final interview (1h)

Benefits

You Can Enjoy
  • Flexible working hours and location
  • Flat hierarchy
  • You can make the role your own and run your own development
  • Online language classes to improve your Spanish, Catalan or English
  • Online and onsite courses and music industry workshops run by inhouse experts
  • We’ll provide you with all equipment needed for you to be comfortable
  • Unlimited time off because we believe that you know best when you need to rest.
  • Barcelona HQ office available to you, kitted out with a rehearsal room https://www.bmat.com/bmat-house/
Who the FAQ are BMAT

BMAT started in 2005 when a group of engineers with a passion for music decided to spin-off from an audio research lab in Barcelona. We’re now over 160 people, spread across Barcelona, Buenos Aires, Lima, Rio de Janeiro, London, Paris, New Jersey, Oslo, LA, Singapore, Tokyo, Manila, Bangkok and Lagos.

We’re a team of pretty decent people who enjoy working with each other. We’re open-minded and well-traveled, coming from all parts of the world. We’ve got rappers, producers, cello players, DJs, and songwriters. The passion for music and the excitement for innovative technology have proven to make a good combination.

We say there’s a BMAT touch. We believe it has to do with being passionate, obsessive, nice, generous, honest, self-motivated, entrepreneurial, intrepid, crazy, extraordinary, creative, agile, human, friendly, smart, witty, talented, naive, optimistic, surprising, sensual, and nerdy, but not very hipster (unfortunately). Our way of being is always sprinkled with transparency, perseverance, flexibility, open-mindedness and trustworthiness.

BMAT has grown as a company of companies. Within BMAT there are a number of products and services that developed semi autonomously for different players – Digital Service Providers, Publishers and Collective Management Organisations.

Diverse perspectives drive innovation, and innovation is kind of our thing. Our open-minded and flexible culture organically fosters this diversity. We've learnt that we thrive on learning from each other, so we don't just welcome but actively hire a range of open-minded people from all walks of life. Our team is made up of people with different backgrounds, perspectives, orientations, abilities, musical tastes, dress sense and time-zones - but we all have one common goal: Making the music world a better place. With equal opportunities for everyone, BMAT is a pretty nice place to work.

results.title: Senior Product Manager
results.description:
Our Sr. Product Managers work closely with clients and cross-functional teams to build the right things, in the right way at all stages of the product life cycle. Senior Product Managers at 3Pillar have a track record of success delivering digital solutions at scale. They work with clients to define business goals, identify opportunities, develop road maps, and manage the iterative delivery of new products and services. As client-facing technologists, they are skilled at building and communicating strategy, impact, and opportunity to a wide range of audiences and influencing decision-making 

We are 3PILLAR GLOBAL We build breakthrough software products that power digital businesses. We are an innovative product development partner whose solutions drive rapid revenue, market share, and customer growth for industry leaders in Software and SaaS, Media, Communications, Technology, Retail, Healthcare, Life Sciences, Private Equity, Banking, Financial Services, and Insurance.  Our key differentiator is our Product Mindset. Our development teams focus on building for outcomes and all of our team members around the globe are trained on the Product Mindset’s core values – Minimize Time to Value, Solve For Need, and Excel at Change. Our teams apply this mindset to build digital products that are customer-facing and revenue-generating. Our business-minded approach to agile development ensures that we align to client goals from the earliest conceptual stages through market launch and beyond. 


Responsibilities:
  • Develop product strategy, enabling a transition from project thinking to continuous delivery of value.
  • Align stakeholders, including executive leadership, to a shared understanding of the product vision and business model, including market, problem, persona, stakeholders, and goals.
  • Collaborate with our clients to build an outcome-based roadmap, aligning features to those outcomes.
  • Act as the cross-functional team lead of distributed design and engineering members from our locations in the US, India, Latin America and Romania.
  • Work with the engineering lead to manage the overall progress of a project and use of resources, including the initiation of corrective action if required.
  • Drive the team to progressively execute against a short-term plan by prioritizing and planning the content and timeline for releases.
  • Effectively make prioritization tradeoffs within the confines of product goals.
  • Write complex stories for implementation by the team, including acceptance criteria.
  • Lead the iteration review, and build consensus on changes/additions to subsequent iterations.
  • Lead the iteration retrospective, assign action items, and track progress of action items from prior retrospectives.
  • Communicate plans, priorities, and status to the client, team members, and internal management as appropriate.
  • Maintain a high awareness of industry issues and trends, particularly in regards to accessibility, usability, and emerging technologies, with a view to incorporating these in future projects and staying ahead of the market.


Qualifications:
  • Minimum of 6 years of experience in a Product Management position leading cross-functional teams and delivering measurable success.
  • Expertise working with complex digital products and a variety of clients.
  • Well versed in User Research; championing user needs to leadership and development teams.
  • Ability to identify organizational goals and challenges and use them to create an outsized impact.
  • Define key metrics for success and deliver measurable results. 
  • Familiarity with Data Analytics is a plus. 
  • Proven ability to navigate ambiguity and challenging stakeholder situations.  


Preferred Qualifications:
  • Entrepreneurial spirit & ability to wear many hats with minimal direction.
  • Strong bias for data-driven decision-making.
  • Quick decision-making abilities demonstrating bias for action under tight timing and pressure.
  • Demonstrated user obsession and passion for product.
  • Intensely curious with the ability to see things differently.  Willing to challenge the status quo and ask questions.
  • You have the ability to navigate a complex organization and the ability to lead through influence. 
  • Demonstrated ability to shepherd multiple stakeholders to a decision is important.
  • Technical background or familiarity working with engineers towards building products.
  • Proven ability to work with product designers and user experience teammates.

results.title: Senior Product Manager, Ground
results.description:
About DroneDeploy
We’re the leading drone software provider making commercial drone data accessible to anyone, anywhere. Trusted by users across various industries, we’re transforming how businesses collect, manage, and analyze worksite data. Our user-friendly platform makes it possible for companies of any size to improve their workflows through scalable image processing, data storage, and real-time sharable drone maps and 3D models. 
 
We are committed to a global work environment that empowers employees to innovate, grow professionally, and make meaningful impacts. We’re recognized as a # 1 Best Place to Work in the SF Bay Area and have made the Top 200 list of America’s Best Startups. Our employees are creative, driven, and committed to providing our customers with the best drone software in the industry. Our office locations include San Francisco, California | Sydney, Australia | Auckland, New Zealand.
 
Role Overview
This role can be worked 100% remotely or in a hybrid manner from our San Francisco Office.
 
DroneDeploy’s product & engineering team works to bring game-changing computer vision technology to market to improve safety and efficiency for every job site. Over 1 Million datasets are uploaded to our platform each year, with 3D Aerial and Ground data being generated in over 200 countries worldwide. DroneDeploy’s product team is highly customer-focused, and you should expect to spend a lot of time with our customers, including travel to job sites. You’ll develop your own product vision and a strategy that will make the largest possible impact on the market.
 
We are looking for an experienced product manager to join our Ground data team to own the web experience on our StructionSite & Walkthrough platforms, accelerating DroneDeploy’s business in the Construction and Energy industries. You will be responsible for our web strategy, prioritizing the most pressing problems for our customers, and developing the right tools and workflows that provide the most impactful solutions. You’ll deliver intuitive user experiences that delight and engage customers. DroneDeploy’s Ground product is our fastest growing and you will need to work cross-functionally across product, engineering, sales, and marketing to deliver on the massive growth opportunity.



Responsibilities
  • Develop product strategy & roadmap for our StructionSite and Walkthrough products, in partnership with the Director Of Product - Ground.
  • Deeply understand our customers and prospects in the Construction and Energy Verticals. Learn about and clearly document their goals & frustrations. Educate the team on your research. 
  • Partner closely with your partners in Design and Engineering, delivering pragmatic solutions that drive significant value for customers. You’ll be contributing to strategy across multiple teams, investing about $2-3M of developer time each year.
  • Lead product decisions on priorities, help resolve issues and develop and communicate your roadmap to the company and your team.
  • Develop a clear revenue growth plan, and contribute to our packaging approach. Help the Go to Market team to focus their efforts.
  • Lead high-level relationships with strategic partners where they connect to your product.
  • Own the delivery of the product through launch, customer acquisition, adoption, activity, and long-term iteration and improvements.



Requirements
  • 4+ years experience in building SAAS products.
  • Day-to-day experience as a Product Owner in an agile environment with a dedicated development team.
  • Experience delivering full-stack product features to customers.
  • Comfortable seeking and using product usage tracking or operational data & data analysis tools to drive product decisions.
  • Able to work between Monday - Friday, 8-5 pm PST.
  • Available to travel domestically and internationally occasionally for work-related events such as conferences, customer meetings, company in-person gatherings, pieces of training, and other business needs.
  • BONUS: Experience using UI/UX tools such as Figma, Sketch, InVision, Zeplin.io

results.title: Head of Product
results.description:
Head of Product

Who is Serotonin?

Serotonin is the leading breakthrough marketing and communications partner for digital asset companies, working with the top businesses and entrepreneurs in the industry on brand positioning, media relations, content, growth marketing, and go-to-market strategy. We bring together a deep expertise in financial services, digital assets, and decentralizing technologies to help innovators tackle some of the biggest challenges facing business and society by building the next generation of products, services, and experiences.

About the role.

Serotonin is seeking an experienced Head of Product to build Serotonin’s next product. This person will work with the key stakeholders and develop this product from 0-1. This Head of Product will identify, hire, and manage their team to ensure the long term success of this product. The ideal candidate should have 6-10+ years of experience building products from inception to launch for early and growth-stage technology companies; and should be well versed in fintech and/or web3 technology. 

Responsibilities

  • Own the vision, strategy, roadmap, and delivery for Serotonin’s next product. 
  • Develop a deep understanding of all stakeholders - leadership, founders, and other community members - and how to incentivize growth of a flywheel among them.
  • Partner effectively with other internal stakeholders internally to influence priorities and drive alignment
  • Monitor project execution and ensure that the project delivery is to the appropriate levels of quality and in line with target dates
  • Hire, mentor, and retain a team of high-performing professionals
  • Ability to drive out clarity from ambiguity and thrive (opportunity, vision, strategy, roadmap, go-to-market)
  • Consistently executes on fast feedback loops (build, measure, learn)
  • Works closely with customers and adjacent internal teams (marketing, legal, etc) to produce positive outcomes
  • Conduct market research to develop a deep understanding of our users' needs and to conceptualize new updates/features that customers will want.
  • Conduct customer interviews and present key metrics to leadership to track product performance.

Requirements:

  • 6-10 years experience in a leadership product management role. 
  • A proven track record of successful 0-1 product launches.
  • Crypto/web3 native
  • Technologist by experience or education; comfortable communicating high-level benefits and digging into the technical weeds
  • Exceptional and excellent communication skills, both written and spoken
  • Experience working remotely with a globally distributed team

Bonus:

  • Experience working in a fast-paced start-up or agency environment
  • Experience working with emergent technology brands and businesses
